intro: Myrrhis odorata, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, pleasant scent, which contributes to its common name. Myrrhis odorata is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in culinary and medicinal applications.
